revised_title: Testing Homology in Turtles: The Pectoral Girdle
tldr: The author examines the homology of the pectoral girdle in turtles using a phylogenetic framework and character congruence. They argue that the acromion, a key structure in the pectoral girdle, is homologous to an anterior process of the scapular blade in pareiasaurs rather than the anterior coracoid of basal amniotes. This finding supports a gradualistic interpretation of the turtle's unique body plan.
